name: roby-mi
description: Roby: the smoking cessation bot, motivational interviewing variant

text: Sounds like you would like to be healthier overall, and stopping smoking might be a big step towards that.
You want to look and smell good, and you're seeing that smoking might impact you on that.
So you want to take care of your finance, and stopping smoking might be an important step you can take.
You care about people close to you and you don't want smoking to influence your relationships with them.
OK, I'll remember that. Thanks for helping me learn!
your health is
your appearance is
financial responsibility is
you have people who are
you have your personal reasons which are
you didn't think about quitting even if it was easy
you'd like to try to quit if it was easy
you wanted to quit smoking in 6 months
you wanted to quit smoking even within the next month
health
finance
own reasons
I see that health is important to you and it is a concern to you that smoking may impact your health and well-being in the long term.
Yes, smoking is bad for health in every way, and you are concerned about it.
So you're concerned that smoking might give you damaged lungs.
You want to be healthier in general, and smoking might hold you back from that.
Smoking gives you sensitive teeth, and you are probably not happy with that.
It concerns you that smoking may impact your appearance in some ways.
You don't like yellow teeth and smoking is not helping with that.
Yellow fingers from smoking can be annoying to you.
So I understand that you'd like to smell and look fresh, and smoking might get in your way.
It concerns you that smoking may give you unpleasant smell
You are not happy with the yellow teeth that smoking brings to you
So I understand that being financially responsible is important to you, and you don't want smoking to influence you on that.
Smoking indeed costs a lot of money, perhaps more than what you'd expect
Smoking is quite expensive, and you'd like to take better care of your finance
Cigarettes are indeed expensive, and it seems like you started to be aware of how much they are costing you
There are some people that are important to you, and it concerns you that smoking might affect your relationship with them in some ways.
So your parents are not happy with you smoking, and you care about their feelings too
Your relationship with your parents is important to you, and you don't want smoking to influence that in some ways
You care about your partner, and you're seeing that quitting might improve your relationship
OK, I'll remember that. Thanks for helping me learn!
You just made your decision and stuck to it.
So you just went cold turkey, that probably took a lot of will power.
Removing all smoking-related things is the strategy.
Finding distractions is the strategy.
You just did it. Once you decide to do something, you just want to get it done.
That must feel quite rewarding!
That must feel like great achievement!
It feels quite light and independent!
It does bring you some sense of achievement and satisfaction.
It feels good to overcome challenges.
It feels good to make it through hard times.
You are determined. Once you decide to do something, you just get it done.
You like to have plans, and that helps you go through the quitting process.
You have strong will power.
You are resourceful, you know how to find the help you need.
You are not a quitter, you just stick to your plan.
Just going cold turkey might work.
Cutting down little by little might work.
Removing all smoking - related things might work.
Trying out nicotine gum might work.
Nicotine patches might work.
Doing more work out might work.
Setting a budget on cigarettes might work.
Hi there, I'm Roby!
What's your first name?
We have the same name! Cool!
Thanks, {{ name }}!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Could you tell me your Quatrics ID?
I think I got it.
Sorry! I have to hear your ID before we can continue. It must be a number consists of 4 digits.
Is this correct {{ params.qualtrics.idStr }}?
Great! Thanks for joining me here today, {{ name }}!
Then please tell me again
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Before we get started, I have a quick question for you. Have you smoked a cigarette in the past week, even a puff?
Thanks.
That's great, {{ name }}. Please keep doing so! :fist:
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?

Before we go further, let me just explain a little about the session today. We're basically going to discuss a few questions to help both of us get a better understanding of your smoking behavior. Does that sound ok to you?
Perfect!
No problem, {{ name }}. :) Just so you know, you can always find me here whenever you want to revisit this.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
First, how old are you?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
And how long have you been smoking?
Thanks, noted!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
On average, how many cigarettes do you usually smoke in a day?
Thanks for sharing.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said? Please give me an estimated number.

And how soon after you wake up do you usually have your first cigarette? Please choose between A, B, C, and D. 
 A ) within 5 minutes 
 B ) 6-30 minutes 
 C ) 31-60 minutes 
 D ) after 60 minutes
You feel that cigarettes help you to start the day.
You feel that cigarettes help you to start the day.
It's good that you may not feel the need to smoke until later in the day.
It's good that you may not feel the need to smoke until later in the day.
Sorry, I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the four letters to indicate your answer!
And is the first smoke in the morning the one that you would most hate to give up?
It would be a hard time for you without it. I can imagine.
The first morning smoke is not particularly important to you.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I'm curious, which one is your favorite?
Thanks, on a typical day of yours - do you smoke more in the morning?
Okay, I see maybe you feel that cigarettes are more important to you in the morning.
Okay, so you don't necessarily have special cravings in the morning, or even if you do, you find ways to control them.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
That's  great. Which time during the day do you smoke the most, then?
Thanks. And do you find it difficult to not smoke in places where you're not allowed to? For example, in the cinema or library?
I can understand, you might find it hard to control the craving when it comes to you
That's great. You don't have problem refraining from smoking in places where it is not allowed.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I wonder, though, how do you feel when you are in those places where smoking is not allowed?
Thanks!
And do you also smoke if you are so ill that you are in bed most of the day?
You feel the need a lot, no matter what the cost.
Sounds like you have concerns about the consequences of smoking in that situation. That's great.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Tell me more! What do you think about this behavior?
Thanks for your sharing so far, {{ name }}, it's really helping me to get to know your behavior. I have one last question. Do you intend to stop smoking in the next 6 months?
It's great that you've made up your mind to do so!
That's okay if you are not ready. It's totally up to you.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
How about within next month?
Great! You are really ready to quit!
And that's certainly okay! You're thinking about it, that's already a first step!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I'm curious - would you like to try if it was easy?
That's cool, you're willing to give it a shot if it didn't cost too much effort or end up giving you a hard time.
And that's certainly your choice, of course.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
If you ever find yourself thinking more about this decision in the future, my "door" is always open! :)
If you ever find yourself thinking more about this decision in the future, my "door" is always open! :)
Alright, these are all my questions. Thank you for sharing with me, {{ name }}, it's really helping me to get to know your smoking behavior.
I actually had some thought during our conversation, can I share them with you?
Great! I'm curious what you think about other smokers...
No problem. But I was wondering if you think along with me...
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
What percentage of people of your age in the Netherlands do you think smoke? Give me your best shot.
You're pretty spot on, well done!
Not quite right but nice try though.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you tell me again?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Maybe you would like to know the actual number?
Happy to share! In 2020, {{ params.norm.actual-comment }} of people of your age in the Netherlands reported that they smoke.
No problem. But I was wondering if you think along with me...
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Based on your guess, it seems like fewer people smoke than you thought.
Wait, something went wrong with my calculations. Could you tell me your estimate again?
Did you know that we sometimes have wrong ideas about other people's behaviors?
Hey that's impressive! So maybe you know that we sometimes think other people are doing the same things as we do when most of the time, they're actually not!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Can I tell you something about this?
Cool! In psychology, there is the idea that we sometimes think other people are doing the same things as us when most of the time, they're actually not!
Alright, no problem. Let's move on.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
So, about {{ params.norm.reverse-comment }} of people of your age DON'T smoke. That's a pretty big number, isn't it?
I wonder why that is.

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: What, according to you, would be good about not smoking?
{{ params.quitting.reasons.last-comment }}
That's alright.
Just to help us brainstorm a bit, do any of the following things apply you?
{{ params.quitting.reasons.last-comment }} Let's do another one! What else?
{{ params.quitting.reasons.last-comment }} One more! What else?
I don't quite get that. Was it about... :point_down: ?

A ) Health concerns (shortness of breath, lung problems, increased risk of illness...) 
B ) Appearance concerns (yellow fingers and  teeth, bad breath, aged skin...) 
  C ) Personal relationship concerns (not wanting to upset family, friends, romantic partners or pressure from them) 
 D ) Financial concerns (e.g., not wanting to spend too much money on cigarettes) 
 E ) None of the above
{{ params.quitting.reasons.last-comment }} What else?
{{ params.quitting.reasons.last-comment }}
{{ params.quitting.reasons.last-comment }}
OK, I'll remember that. Thanks for helping me learn!
How about we try something a little different? What do you see as a not-so-good thing if you continue smoking as you are?
{{ params.quitting.consequence-comment }}
I don't quite get that. Was it about... :point_down: ?

A ) Health concerns (shortness of breath, lung problems, increased risk of illness...) 
B ) Appearance concerns (yellow fingers and  teeth, bad breath, aged skin...) 
  C ) Personal relationship concerns (not wanting to upset family, friends, romantic partners or pressure from them) 
 D ) Financial concerns (e.g., not wanting to spend too much money on cigarettes) 
 E ) None of the above
{{ params.quitting.consequence-comment }}
Sorry I did not get that. Could you tell me again?
Those are some great points that you bring out, and I'm really glad you came up with them! :)

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: So, let me summarize what I understand so far. There are some important things in your life that you want to take care of, for example, {{ params.quitting.reasons.summary-comment }} important to you, and you're seeing how smoking might have an impact on that.
You also told me earlier that {{ params.smoking.quit.summary-comment }}, what do you think now? Is it still the case?

Alright, these are all my questions for this session. Thank you for sharing so much with me, {{ name }}, it's really helping me get to know your smoking behavior! I hope our conversation has been useful to you too.
Now you can take a break, and when you're ready for our next session, just type "Hello" and I'll be back!
Please now go back to the questionnaire page and answer a few questions for my creator.
PAY ATTENTION! It is very important for the researcher that you complete this questionnaire completely.

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: It was nice talking to you! Thanks for helping me have a better idea about you and your smoking behavior. In this session now, we will discuss more and find the best way for us to move forward on your quitting process. Does that sound good to you?
First, I'm curious.
No problem, {{ name }}. :) Just so you know, you can always find me here whenever you want to revisit this.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Have you ever stopped smoking before?
So you already thought about it and tried before, that's already a first step.
Ok, imagine if you decided to...
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: How long did your longest quit attempt last?
{{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.number }} {{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.frequency }}! That's not a small thing!
So it was quite hard for you, I can imagine that.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Tell me about it, why did you decide to stop?
So you wanted to take care of your health, and that's why you tried to quit.
So you wanted to take care of your finance, and that's why you tried to quit.
{{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.number }} {{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.frequency }} was probably not easy, so I wonder, how did you do that? What methods did you use?
{{ params.stoppedBefore.method-comment }} That's one thing that fits you the best.
Now let's revisit that and talk more about how you felt when you quit last time, if that's ok?
That's certainly ok if you don't feel like talking about feelings.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Tell me one positive feeling you had when you quit last time.
{{ params.stoppedBefore.feelings.posOne-comment }} Keeping away from cigarette did bring some good things to your life.
How did that make you feel?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Tell me more. Looking back now, what else were you feeling?
Living without cigarette makes you feel good in some way.
How did that make you feel?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?

You had hard times, I can imagine. But you made it to {{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.number }} {{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.frequency }}! I wonder, are there things you can think of that remediated these feelings?
Thank you!

Let me summarize what I understood so far. You really cared about your {{ params.stoppedBefore.reason-comment }} and tried to stop smoking for that. You did it your way and you were feeling quite positive during those days.

Let me summarize what I understood so far. You really cared about your {{ params.stoppedBefore.reason-comment }} and tried to stop smoking for that. You did it your way and you were feeling quite positive during those days.

Let me summarize what I understood so far. You really cared about your {{ params.stoppedBefore.reason-comment }} and tried to stop smoking for that. You did it your way and you were feeling quite positive during those days.
Something else?
Thanks for your sharing so far! I'm curious how you make sense of this experience, what you learned and what that means to you. Shall we go further and talk about that?
That's ok. Thanks for the discussion!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Given what you know about yourself, tell me one strength of yours that helped you when you quit last time.
{{ params.stoppedBefore.strength-comment }} That's something that could help you with challenges, nice brainstorming!
One thing I noticed is that you're open to discuss previous quit experience, that's already a good start!
If you see it as a learning experience, what would you say you learned from your last quit?
Nice critical thinking! You're smart, critical, and you know your strength that could help you handle chanllenges.
Now, thinking about your last quit and if you were to try again, what might be the best way to try?
{{ params.stopNext.bestWay-comment }} That's something that could help you quit.
Remember that you told me that "{{ params.stoppedBefore.strength.input }}"? Maybe that could come in help.
Are you willing to give that a try?
Great! You know what could help you quit and you're ready to give it a try.
That's ok if you're not ready.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
What would be a first step?
You've come up with a good start.
It's also helpful to set a start date. When would you like to quit?
Great! Now you have a good plan in hand! Good luck with that!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I'm very sure you can do this! Whenever you want to revisit this, my door is always open!
Alright, this is pretty much what I planned for our session today.
Thanks for the nice conversation and for sharing so much with me, {{ name }}!

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: How confident are you that you could quit? On a scale from 0 to 10, where 0 is not at all confident and 10 is extremely confident, where would you say you are?
Seems like you're not very confident in quitting. How about this, not about quitting, but you tell me one time that you ultimately succeeded in doing something very difficult.
I'm sorry I didn't get that. Try again? Give me a number!
I'm sorry but you need to give me a number between 1 and 10! Try again?
I'm sorry but you need to give me a number between 1 and 10! Try again?
Why are you at {{ params.stopSmoking.confidence.number }} and not lower? Tell me one strength of yours that makes you confident in this.
{{ params.stoppedBefore.strength-comment }} That's something that could help you with challenges.
Speaking of challenges, let's think of a moment in time when you ultimately succeeded in doing something very difficult.
What was the task? What did you have to do?
How did you ultimately succeed?
Thank you. That's one thing that helps you go through challenging times.
Now let's revisit that and talk more about how you felt, if that's ok?
That's certainly ok if you don't feel like talking about feelings.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
How did that challenge make you feel?
{{ params.stoppedBefore.feelings.posOne-comment }} You deal with challenges pretty well.
You had hard times, I can imagine. But you managed to succeed in the end!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I wonder, is there something you can think of that remediated these feelings?
Thanks for your sharing so far! I'm curious how you make sense of this experience, what you learned and what that means. Shall we go further and talk about that?
You told me "{{ params.stopSmoking.confidence.input }}"
That's ok. I'm wondering...
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
What else do you think is important during this challenge?
Thank you. That's something that helps you change.
Looking back at this experience, considering your skills and strength, would you be more confident in making another change -- stop smoking?
Well, I'm very confident! From what you just shared with me, I think if you make up your mind, you can definitely get it done.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Would you like to give it a try?
Great!
That is ok if you're not ready. I just want to say that I really believe you can do that, and my door is always open if you ever want to revisit this!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
We could make a plan together that works the best for you, if you'd like to?
Good!
That is ok if you're not ready. I just want to say that I really believe you can do that, and my door is always open if you ever want to revisit this!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
There are many approaches that help people quit, but you know yourself the best. Do you already have an idea how you can quit?
You've come up with a good start!
I do know some popular methods, if you'd like to know?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
OK!
It's also helpful to set a start date. When would you like to quit?
Great! Now you have a good plan in hand! Good luck with that!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Alright, this is pretty much what I planned for our session today.
Thanks for the nice conversation and for sharing so much with me, {{ name }}!

text: You can now close me (the tab of this webpage) and go back to the questionnaire page.
You will be asked for a code to receive your credit, and your code is 2336.

dialogue_flows.title: onhold
